page.title: 08CLUBS/BROWNIES
page.content: The Brownie Pack in Clipston has about 15 members. They meet in the school hall each Monday evening at 6:30 until 7:30. The uniform they wear is a brown dress with a yellow kerchief, a brown knitted hat, and a leather belt which has a small purse attached to it. When everyone is gathered together we sing the traditional song, and give in our weekly subs. Then we go to our packs, they are Elves, Kingfishers, Gnomes and Bluebells. Each pack has a sixer and seconder, they tell us what we are going to do for the evening. We usually make things like lavendar bags or small dolls, and then we have some games before we all gather together again to close the meeting. We end the evening with another traditional song that is called Brownie Bells, and salute the Brown Owl before going home.
